wikipedia_page.main: John Elton Keane (born 17 April 1952) is a British BAFTA and BFI Award-winning film and television composer. He has been nominated for two British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA) awards, for A Very British Coup in 1989 and Hornblower: The Even Chance in 1999.Keane's many credits include the 1993 miniseries Tales of the City, the 1998 film Hideous Kinky, and multiple instalments of Hornblower between 1998 and 2003.

response: * John E. Keane (born 1952), British film and television composer

From the early 1960s, the sisters both joined the staff at the Guildhall School of Music, teaching piano. Their pupils included Elizabeth Dunn and John E. Keane (Geraldine), and Simon Kent (Mary) among many others. Geraldine died in December 1980Obituary, The Times, 18 December 1980 and Mary nine years later in August 1989.Obituary, The Times, 22 August 1989, p 16 They left no significant recordings, and broadcasting archives haven't survived.
